00020 #if defined(__CYGWIN32__) || defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined ( __linux )
00021 #define USE_UNIX_HEADERS
00022 #elif defined (__SVR4) || defined (__MACH__)
00023 #define USE_UNIX_HEADERS
00024 #endif
00025 
00026 #ifdef USE_UNIX_HEADERS
00027    // Some of these are not strictly needed in linux, but
00028    // needed in the other os:es. E.g. linux includes
00029    // sys/types.h and limits.h in sys/param.h which is not
00030    // done in FreeBSD and solaris.
00031    #include <limits.h>
00032    #include <sys/types.h>
00033    #include <sys/param.h>
00034    #include <sys/socket.h>
00035    #include <sys/time.h>
00036    #include <netinet/in.h>
00037    #include <arpa/inet.h>
00038    #include <netdb.h>
00039    #include <unistd.h>
00040 
00041    #include <fcntl.h>
00042    #include <signal.h>
00043 
00044    typedef  int   SOCKET;
00045    #ifndef SOCKET_ERROR
00046       #define SOCKET_ERROR -1
00047    #endif
00048 #endif
00049 
00050 // This part is a bit strange, since it would mean that
00051 // winsock.h will be included in Cygwin, or?
00052 
00053 #ifdef _WIN32
00054    #include <winsock.h>
00055    #define socklen_t int 
00056    #define ssize_t int
00057    #ifndef SOCKET_ERROR
00058       #define SOCKET_ERROR INVALID_SOCKET
00059    #endif
00060    // unsigned int
00061 #endif
